Text: Gibborim, thanks for Inferno!  I have not listened to it all yet, but the first part works fine.
Horrible sound, but looks like it's the whole book. Will wait for a book I can bear hearing, though.

True, the quality is quite bad, lots of noise in the background. Think I'll wait also for a better one but thanks for the Quick upload! If you HAVE the original maybe you could make Another high quality upload?

Well, I have listened to parts of every section of this book, and they are very clear with no background noise so I do not understand why some people are having trouble.  Maybe it has something to do with how the .ror file is opened.  I used Stuffit Expander.
Strange. On my computer its very good but on my smartphone its very noisy. All other audiobooks are ok though on both machines. Any ideas why this is?

Probably my last update--The recording sounds fine on my computer and mp3 player.  I even made some CD's and they sound fine.  I guess you just have to try this on your system and see what happens.  Good luck.

I'm listening to it right now, and it's fine!!  I think that it's not been recorded in the highest bit rate, but for spoken words, like this, with no music, that's fine.  I use WinAmp, and it sounds good to me.  I'm enjoying a new Dan Brown novel.
